newsitem.title: KUWAIT: Kuwait halves 1995/96 budget deficit - agency. [CORRECTED 09:00 GMT 26/10]
newsitem.headline: Kuwait halves 1995/96 budget deficit - agency. [CORRECTED 09:00 GMT 26/10]

text.p: Kuwait slashed a projected 1.32 billion dinar ($4.4 billion) (corrects from 1.2 billion dinars) deficit for the fiscal year 1995/96 to 653 million dinars, the official Kuwaiti news agency KUNA reported on Friday.

It quoted Finance Minister Nasser Abdulla al-Rodhan as saying the deficit amounted to about 653 million dinars despite expectations that it would reach 1.32 billion dinars (corrects from 1.2 billion dinars).
He said "stronger oil prices played a role in these positive developments" and "this period also witnessed the beginning of serious efforts in controlling expenditures".

Kuwait has said it plans to balance the budget by 2000 after suffering huge losses during the 1990-91 Gulf crisis. The tiny, oil-rich state incurred hefty losses during the 1991 Gulf War which ended its seven-month occupation by Iraq.
The government had projected spending of 4.23 billion dinars and revenues of 2.91 billion dinars in 1995/96. It adopted a conservative estimate of $13 a barrel of oil, Kuwait's main revenue earner.
Parliament earlier this month passed a 4.2 billion dinar budget for fiscal 1996/97 with a forecast net deficit of 1.2 billion dinars.
